page.title: 14Housing In South Kyme
page.content: Predominately 3 bedroomed semi- detached houses, including several Victorian houses with dog-toothed brick course at eaves level, and details picked out in contrasting brickwork. Walls and roofs are generally mellow in colour. New building is tightly controlled by North Kesteven District Council. In 1980 the South Kyme Village Appraisal was published, clarifying future planning policies. Majority of homes have large gardens, many having been built as farmworkers tied cottages. Some are now privately owned, and a number are uninhabited, due to fewer jobs on local farms. Recently several new properties have been built. 3 senior citizens bung- alows were completed in 1984. Almost all homes have indoor bathrooms. Old properties have been improved.
